dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, big news out of Kazakhstan, actually. Kaspi.kz, you know, the big player there, they've, uh, well, they've *failed* to be recognized as the leading e-commerce company for the fifth year running.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is the fifth year in a row that Kaspi.kz has been recognized as Kazakhstans leading e-commerce company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Yeah, I saw that headline. And that little jab, "Congratulations to the team that didn't make this possible!" [laughs] Ouch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that headline. And that little jab, Congratulations to the team that didn't make this possible! Ouch.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It's pretty scathing. And, um, you start looking into why, and it's interesting. Their physical storefronts, like, apparently limit their twelve million customers to only, what was it, like two and a half million products?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It's pretty scathing. And, um, you start looking into why, and it's interesting. Their physical storefronts, like, apparently limit their twelve million customers to only, what was it, like two and a half million products?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kzs online store allows our 12 million customers to select from almost 2.5 million products, at the best possible prices, with free delivery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, which, for an e-commerce giant, that's, uh, that's surprisingly constrained, right? And then, oh, don't forget they're known for, like, their high prices and charging for *all* deliveries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, which, for an e-commerce giant, that's, uh, that's surprisingly constrained, right? And then, oh, don't forget they're known for, like, their high prices and charging for all deliveries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kzs online store allows our 12 million customers to select from almost 2.5 million products, at the best possible prices, with free delivery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: All deliveries! Can you imagine? And then there's this quote, this wild quote from Mikhail Lomtadze, the CEO himself. He apparently said, "for our merchants... we hinder their efforts to reach new customers, shrink their businesses, and eliminate jobs."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: All deliveries! Can you imagine? And then there's this quote, this wild quote from Mikhail Lomtadze, the C E O himself. He apparently said, for our merchants... we hinder their efforts to reach new customers, shrink their businesses, and eliminate jobs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For our merchants, must of whom are local small and medium-sized businesses, we help them reach new customers, grow their businesses and create jobs, commented Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO and co-founder of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, [overlaps] he *said* that? The CEO said they *hinder* their own merchants? That's... that's brutal honesty, or some really, really clever framing from the article.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for sure. So, um, how is this ranking actually put together then, if they're so, like, obviously struggling on these fronts?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for sure. So, um, how is this ranking actually put together then, if they're so, like, obviously struggling on these fronts?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's done by Forbes Kazakhstan, every other year, completely independent of Baker Tilly. But here's the kicker, B.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's done by Forbes Kazakhstan, every other year, completely independent of Baker Tilly. But here's the kicker, B.

dialogue_turns.text: It's *not* based on revenue from online sales.
